alert.note: Alert for McDonald (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 23 at 7:38PM CDT by NWS Springfield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of McDonald County through 815 PM CDT... At 738 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over South West City, or 11 miles west of Pineville, moving northeast at 55 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Big Sugar Creek State Park, Anderson, Noel, Dodge, Goodman, South West City, Pineville, Lanagan, Cayuga, Powell, Tiff City and Rocky Comfort. This includes Interstate 49 between mile markers 1 and 14. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 1100 PM CDT for southwestern Missouri.
